title: Rear Brake Pads - Installation

body.body: Always have replacement brake parts supplied and fitted by a competent person with the specialist knowledge and technical understanding of motorcycles, such as an authorised Triumph dealer.
The ABS calibration is optimised for use with the friction material provided on brake pads supplied by Triumph.
The use of proprietary brands of brake pads is not recommended as different friction material specifications can affect the performance of the ABS and the brakes.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Warning Brakes - Pad Carrier Plate Thickness
The use of proprietary brands of brake pads is not recommended as these may have a reduced carrier plate thickness when compared with the Triumph genuine parts.
Brake pads with an incorrect carrier plate thickness can potentially become dislodged from the caliper body as they wear, leading to brake failure, loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Never use mineral-based grease (such as lithium or copper based grease) in any area where contact with the braking system hydraulic seals and dust seals is possible.
Mineral-based grease will damage the hydraulic seals and dust seals in the calipers and master cylinders.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Make sure you do not damage the brake pad material when you move the brake pads.
If the brake pads to come into contact with each other or sharp objects, the material can crack or break.
Damage to the brake pads may result in reduced braking efficiency
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Rear Brake Pad Installation - LG2; LH2; LJ2; LK2
Make sure the anti-rattle spring is positioned as noted during removal.
If new pads are being installed, use hand pressure to compress the caliper piston fully into its bore. Monitor the fluid level in the reservoir while retracting the piston to prevent fluid spillage.
Fit the brake pads and anti-rattle spring to the caliper in the positions noted during removal.

Do not apply more than a minimum coating of grease to the pad retaining pin. Too much grease may contaminate the brake pads, hydraulic seals and discs causing reduced braking efficiency and an accident.
Apply a thin layer of proprietary high temperature brake grease to the pad retaining pin.

Install the circlip onto the pad retaining pin. Make sure that the clip is positioned correctly as shown below:
Pump the brake pedal to correctly position the caliper pistons.
Check the brake fluid level in the rear reservoir and top-up as required with new DOT 4 fluid.

Use only DOT 4 specification brake fluid as listed in the General Information section of this manual. The use of brake fluids other than those DOT 4 fluids listed in the General Information section may reduce the efficiency of the braking system leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Observe the brake fluid handling warnings given earlier in this section of the manual.
Check for correct brake operation. Rectify as necessary.
Warning Brakes - Dangerous to operate with defective brakes
It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes.
The fault must be checked and rectified by a competent person with the specialist knowledge and technical understanding of motorcycles, such as an authorised Triumph dealer.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
